posts.post_content: So if someone cast a [journey to nowhere](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=journey to nowhere) targeting feral hydra and afterwards you destroy it, feral hydra will enter the battlefield as a 0/0 creature and will be immediatly sent to the graveyard. You don't get the chance to boost it, right?
posts.html:
So if someone cast a journey to nowhere targeting feral hydra and afterwards you destroy it, feral hydra will enter the battlefield as a 0/0 creature and will be immediatly sent to the graveyard. You don't get the chance to boost it, right?
Report Abuse  
Posted By: TongueSlicer (2/22/2011 1:19:05 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: That is correct, TongueSlicer. The Feral Hydra will enter the battlefield as a 0/0. The only way to save it is to have a global pump effect on the battlefield (Such as having a [Glorious Anthem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glorious Anthem) on the board or casting [Magnify](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magnify) before Journey to Nowhere leaves the battlefield.
posts.html:
That is correct, TongueSlicer. The Feral Hydra will enter the battlefield as a 0/0. The only way to save it is to have a global pump effect on the battlefield (Such as having a Glorious Anthem on the board or casting Magnify before Journey to Nowhere leaves the battlefield.

posts.post_content:
Not a bad creature it itself, but it was completely smoked by the printing of [Primordial Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primordial Hydra). For just one extra {G} up front, you get **trample** and the counters automatically double each of your upkeeps with no further mana investment.  
  
Still, this is fun in commander.
posts.html:

Still, this is fun in commander.
